titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elinor Langer Collection of Josephine Herbst
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday January 19, 2019 at 04:00

did.unittitle: Elinor Langer collection of Josephine Herbst

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection documents Elinor Langer's research and writing of the biography Josephine Herbst: The Story She Could Never Tell. The collection contains research files, correspondence, photographs, sound recordings of interviews, printed material, and other papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 20-21 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Portfolio 22 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Elinor Langer Collection of Josephine Herbst is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Elinor Langer Collection of Josephine Herbst. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection includes materials previously identified by the following call number: Uncat ZA MS 920.

Prior to processing, this collection originally included materials identified by the following call numbers: Uncat ZA MS 108A, Uncat ZA MS 108B, Uncat ZA MS 175, and Uncat ZA File 309. These materials are now part of the Josephine Herbst Papers (YCAL MSS 474) and include Herbst family photographs and personal papers that originally belonged to Herbst. Following Herbst's death, Langer borrowed the material for her work on Josephine Herbst biography, Josephine Herbst: The Story She Could Never Tell .

Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization at the time of acquisition. Further organization and description were carried out in 2011.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Associated material includes the Josephine Herbst Papers (YCAL MSS 474) and other material by or relating to Josephine Herbst can be found by searching Orbis (Yale's Online Catalog).

bioghist.head: Elinor Langer (b. 1939)
bioghist.p: Elinor Langer is the author of the biography, Josephine Herbst: The Story She Could Never Tell .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents Elinor Langer's research and writing of the biography of American author Josephine Herbst, Josephine Herbst: The Story She Could Never Tell . The collection contains research files, correspondence, photographs, sound recordings, printed material, and other papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Research files, 1964-1985. II. Writings and related material, 1968-1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photocopies and notes created during Elinor Langer's research for her biography on Josephine Herbst. The bulk of the material is photocopies of Herbst's personal and professional papers, including her correspondence, writings and notes. There is a small amount of correspondence on Herbst between Langer and various individuals, institutions that hold Herbst material, and with individuals regarding publication permissions and the publication process. Filed at the end of the series are audio cassettes, microcassettes, and one reel-to-reel tape of interviews on Herbst between Langer and individuals.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in the order maintained by Langer.

Helen Herbst letters to her mother, 1908-1920
Mary Frey Herbst letters to JH, 1909-1921

scopecontent.p: Includes letters from Stratford, Iowa, Seattle, Berkeley

Hiss-Chambers material from Allen Weinstein, and related miscellany
Spain JH correspondence with Carlos Baker re Spain, Hemingway, etc.
John Dos Passos letters to JH
Will Watson writing regarding Spain and correspondence with JH about it
El Correspondence re Spain: Seldes, Tisa, Luddington and miscellaneous

Drafts, notes, writings by others on JH
"Confessions of a Female Biographer (speech given by EL)," 1989 May

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains drafts, notes, photocopies, correspondence and photograph reproductions created by Langer as part of her writing process. Among the papers are printed material, publicity, and reviews regarding the publication of Langer's book.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in the order maintained by Langer.
